column4: hey guys trying to change the file permitions using chmod "sudo chmod -vR a+rwxrwxrwx /media/P/Documents". i dont get any errors in the terminal. but if i do "ls -l /media/P/Documents" the file permitions have not changed any ideas ???
just "a+rwx" will do
but i need to copy these files onto a fat32 partition. if i use the in win or osx i will not have full parmition
a stands for "all", as opposed to "u", "g" or "o" :-)
i tryed "a+rwx" and "o+rwx" but all the files in the directory still have "-rwx------" as there permitions. does this mean they are not set?
they're set, just not to what you want. this is a fat32 filesystem, i guess?
yes it is. does chmod support fat32
not exactly. look into mounting the volume with the "umask" and "uid" options set to what you want.
thanks alot i will have a look
what filesystem are you inspecting, and what tool were you using?
i tryed using "debugfs" on "/dev/sda3" ext3
that's not a mounted partition i hope!
lol let me check
no the partition is not mount.
i get the error /dev/sda3: Bad magic number in super-block while opening filesystem
but there are 2 other partitions on the same physical disk. and they are mounted
have you tried running fsck on the filesystem? what were you using debugfs to look for, btw?
you can have a look at the hfsprogs package
or just use a mac, i suppose :-)
hfsprocs is great, lil question what version of debain is used for ubuntu 8.10
ubuntu releases aren't tied to a specific debian release, to my knowledge. did you mean the package version of hfsprogs?
